supporting_quotes: Anand attended Dulwich College
later read law at Trinity College, Cambridge, graduating with honours in 1955
Anand spent 23 years in the foreign service, serving at times as the Ambassador of Thailand to the United Nations
Ambassador of Thailand to Canada 1967 – 1972
Ambassador of Thailand to the United States 1972 – 1976
In January 1976 he was appointed Permanent Secretary of the foreign ministry, and played a leading role in ensuring the US military withdrawal from Thailand
Ambassador of Thailand to West Germany 1979 – 1984
in 1979 left the public sector for the private. He became the Vice-Chairman of the Saha-Union Group in 1979
He has been a Director of Siam Commercial Bank since 1984

roles: Chairman of the Board of Directors
supporting_quotes: and the Chairman of the Board of Directors in 1991

roles: Prime Minister of Thailand (interim, first term)
supporting_quotes: In office 2 March 1991 – 23 March 1992
the NPKC appointed Anand as interim prime minister

roles: Prime Minister of Thailand (interim, second term)
supporting_quotes: In office 10 June 1992 – 22 September 1992
On 10 June 1992, Arthit surprised the country by recommending Anand's name instead of Somboon's to the king
Anand rejoined the Saha-Union Group as chairman after the general elections of 1992
He resigned from Saha-Union Group in 2002
In 1996, Anand was elected as a member of the Constitution Drafting Assembly and was appointed Chairman of the Drafting Committee
Anand served as UNICEF Ambassador for Thailand since 1996

roles: Chair of High-Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change
supporting_quotes: During November 2003 and December 2004, Anand was requested by then United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan to chair the High-Level Panel on Threats, Challenges and Change
From March 2005, Anand served as chairman of the National Reconciliation Commission (NRC)
Anand finally submitted the NRC's recommendations on 5 June 2006
Anand is a member of the Trilateral Commission
and the International Advisory Board of American International Group (AIG)
Anand is a member of the Carlyle Group and sits on the Carlyle Group's advisory board for Asia-Pacific

roles: Ramon Magsaysay Award recipient for Government Service
supporting_quotes: Anand received a Ramon Magsaysay Award for Government Service in 1997

roles: Knight Grand Cordon (Special Class) of the Most Exalted Order of the White Elephant
supporting_quotes: 1991 - Knight Grand Cordon (Special Class) of the Most Exalted Order of the White Elephant

supporting_quotes: 1988 - Knight Grand Cordon (Special Class) of The Most Noble Order of the Crown of Thailand

roles: Knight Grand Cross (First Class) of the Most Admirable Order of the Direkgunabhorn
supporting_quotes: 2003 - Knight Grand Cross (First Class) of the Most Admirable Order of the Direkgunabhorn

roles: Knight Grand Commander (Second Class, higher grade) of the Most Illustrious Order of Chula Chom Klao
supporting_quotes: 1991 - Knight Grand Commander (Second Class, higher grade) of the Most Illustrious Order of Chula Chom Klao

roles: King Rama IX Royal Cypher Medal (Third Class)
supporting_quotes: 1967 - King Rama IX Royal Cypher Medal (Third Class)

roles: Commander of the Order of Merit of the Italian Republic (Third Class)
supporting_quotes: 1961 - Commander of the Order of Merit of the Italian Republic (Third Class)

roles: Order of Diplomatic Service Merit Grand Gwanghwa Medal (First Class)
supporting_quotes: 1970 - Order of Diplomatic Service Merit Grand Gwanghwa Medal (First Class), Republic of Korea
1971 - Star of Merit 1st Class, Indonesia

roles: Grand Officer of the Order of the Crown (Second Class)
supporting_quotes: 1990 - Grand Officer of the Order of the Crown (Second Class), Belgium
